models maybe because they are very similar in some aspects is my phone no longer supported yeah its also a bit old and has some software to hardware issues with it being slow and freezing but im Comment: the iphone pro max while boasting a sleek design and apples signature build quality disappoints on several fronts users have reported overheating problems making prolonged usage uncomfortable the fragile glass back is prone to cracking with minimal impact raising concerns about its durability additionally the display suffers from burnin issues impacting the visual experience lack of multitasking capabilities and pen support limits productivity and the absence of fast charging options is a significant drawback furthermore the phone features a large notch which feels outdated compared to competitors these issues make the iphone pro max fall short of expectations especially considering its premium status

Comment: my experience with the mp photos is a lot more positive than what you are saying theyre way way sharper than a mp photo and this is especially noticable when taking photos of anything with a lot of fine detail such as hair fur tree leaves grass gravel etc etc it is a huge improvement to mobile phone photography and all while only using more space i have also taken some phenomenal photos with the mp heif mode i have owned a few phones that had high res sensors note ultra xiaomi mi ultra s ultra and taken photos using the full mp or mp mode but none of them compared to the ridiculous clarity that i am getting with the mp heif mode i was taking photos of my cat sunbathing in the window yesterday on mp heif and god damn the detail in the fur its crazy the xiaomi was close in qualitydetail but the mp sensor on the note ultra and s ultra just isnt even close in both detail and colour just goes to show that resolution is important but just because one number is higher doesnt necessarily mean its better i dont have an su to compare with and i am sure that is very good too would be good to see some comparisons close up animal photos are a good way to compare these high res modes because of the amount of detail in the fur eyes etc
Cleaned_Comment: my experience with the mp photos is a lot more positive than what you are saying theyre way way sharper than a mp photo and this is especially noticable when taking photos of anything with a lot of fine detail such as hair fur tree leaves grass gravel etc etc it is a huge improvement to mobile phone photography and all while only using more space i have also taken some phenomenal photos with the mp heif mode i have owned a few phones that had high res sensors note ultra xiaomi mi ultra s ultra and taken photos using the full mp or mp mode but none of them compared to the ridiculous clarity that i am getting with the mp heif mode i was taking photos of my cat sunbathing in the window yesterday on mp heif and god damn the detail in the fur its crazy the xiaomi was close in qualitydetail but the mp sensor on the note ultra and s ultra just isnt even close in both detail and colour just goes to show that resolution is important but just because one number is higher doesnt necessarily mean its better i dont have an su to compare with and i am sure that is very good too would be good to see some comparisons close up animal photos are a good way to compare these high res modes because of the amount of detail in the fur eyes etc

Comment: the overheating issues observed in the iphone pro and pro max can be ascribed to how individual applications interact with the devices processor each app possesses a distinct signature that dictates its cpu utilization behavior as a result when the cpu is tasked with concurrently running multiple apps or when apps remain active in the background it continues to actively engage the cpus resources this heightened workload can ultimately lead to cpu overheating thus giving rise to the temperaturerelated concerns experienced by users regarding whether apple will conduct research and development on the million apps in the app store its essential to let you know that its impractical for apple to comprehensively assess each app individually the sheer volume of apps in the store coupled with their constantly evolving nature makes it an unfeasible task consequently this is an aspect that users should anticipate furthermore this situation could contribute to apples ongoing challenges in addressing battery drain issues these issues are often contingent on the individual usage patterns of iphone owners and the specific types of apps they employ making them difficult to resolve through a onesizefitsall approach
Cleaned_Comment: the overheating issues observed in the iphone pro and pro max can be ascribed to how individual applications interact with the devices processor each app possesses a distinct signature that dictates its cpu utilization behavior as a result when the cpu is tasked with concurrently running multiple apps or when apps remain active in the background it continues to actively engage the cpus resources this heightened workload can ultimately lead to cpu overheating thus giving rise to the temperaturerelated concerns experienced by users regarding whether apple will conduct research and development on the million apps in the app store its essential to let you know that its impractical for apple to comprehensively assess each app individually the sheer volume of apps in the store coupled with their constantly evolving nature makes it an unfeasible task consequently this is an aspect that users should anticipate furthermore this situation could contribute to apples ongoing challenges in addressing battery drain issues these issues are often contingent on the individual usage patterns of iphone owners and the specific types of apps they employ making them difficult to resolve through a onesizefitsall approach

Comment: i actually miss the days when a company would release a new phone there would be an excite factor of something new and groundbreaking would be announced high res screens anything higher than hz displays huge leaps in camera quality faster chips for gaming wireless charging announced crazy fast charging speeds announced i could go on and on these days for almost every phone manufacturer is on the same level its all about taste now asus for gaming iphone for ios and samsung for android mainly for the states at least i know huawei xiaomi oppo and others exist but even then they are still even blurring the lines it feels as if we reached a height in tech growth where these companies cant really see or determine what can we do next or what is even possible to do next in the past years the growth has been exponential the next years i cant even see what can be improved awhile back when the htc one m and m were released they absolutely destroyed the market based off of design build materials stereo speakers that were loud and punchy obviously they struggled with cameras because it was back in and but just being so excited about what a game changer those phones were is what really is lacking these days yes all phones these days are great better than ever but we may actually be at the end of the road of the exciting wow factor of new and revolutionary things added to a phone feels more of less just a chip upgrade and camera upgrade these days i love what we have now i just miss the big and exciting leaps we used to see yearly

Comment: im gonna push back on the usbc take i completely understand why its frustrating that c cables arent particularly clear on what their data and power ratings are and i personally believe the consortium needs to do something to make that as clear as possible with that said the whole point of usbc is to be the allencompassing cable it consolidates everything into one neat package but what people forget is we still use other forms of usb those havent gone away and hypothetically speaking if usbc wasnt backwards compatible back to usb then we would still be using those cables alongside c with the likely possibility of having dongles out the wazoo the options were adding usbc as another cable alongside mini micro all as and bs technically not usb type b because its pretty much only used for printers but still basically everything else i mentioned with dongles or backwards compatible usbc where the older ones are slowly phased out and higher rated c cables become ubiquitous while lower rated cables get phased out i can see arguments for both and again the lack of transparency regarding cable rating is extremely annoying but personally i think the current approach is the correct one
Cleaned_Comment: im gonna push back on the usbc take i completely understand why its frustrating that c cables arent particularly clear on what their data and power ratings are and i personally believe the consortium needs to do something to make that as clear as possible with that said the whole point of usbc is to be the allencompassing cable it consolidates everything into one neat package but what people forget is we still use other forms of usb those havent gone away and hypothetically speaking if usbc wasnt backwards compatible back to usb then we would still be using those cables alongside c with the likely possibility of having dongles out the wazoo the options were adding usbc as another cable alongside mini micro all as and bs technically not usb type b because its pretty much only used for printers but still basically everything else i mentioned with dongles or backwards compatible usbc where the older ones are slowly phased out and higher rated c cables become ubiquitous while lower rated cables get phased out i can see arguments for both and again the lack of transparency regarding cable rating is extremely annoying but personally i think the current approach is the correct one

Comment: key takeaways for quick navigation refinement of iphone pro brings subtle changes emphasizing gradual improvements over revolutionary redesigns iphone pro features a softer design slimmer bezels and a lighter build with a new titanium coating showcasing subtle but noticeable improvements introduction of usbc port allows universal compatibility but lacks significant innovation beyond onecable convenience a pro chip brings substantial power rivaling the m chip enhancing gaming capabilities and specialized tasks like fast photo processing and data transfer iphone pro faces potential issues with battery life and sporadic overheating possibly linked to the powerful a pro chip and ios bugs enhanced camera system captures megapixel images by combining detailed and light information offering slight improvements over previous models iphone pros video capabilities continue to dominate the smartphone market featuring k fps log shooting mode and improved stabilization albeit with occasional haloing issues iphone pro max introduces a larger telephoto lens with x zoom enhancing zoom capabilities and stabilization but it may not justify the bulk for most users camera differences among smartphones are heavily reliant on software making personal preference a significant factor iphone pro offers a raw max feature for megapixel pro raw photos providing enhanced customization for photographers the action button on the iphone pro is customizable allowing users to assign various functions but its positioning may limit its accessibility for some users the action buttons usability may vary from person to person some may find it extremely useful while others might forget about it after a few days of use temperature regulation significantly impacts sleep quality the eight sleep pod cover adjusts temperature enhancing sleep experience and providing valuable sleep data insights iphone pro offers incremental improvements such as usbc a faster chip brighter screen thinner bezels and enhanced cameras making personal priorities crucial in the decision to upgrade made with harpa ai
Cleaned_Comment: key takeaways for quick navigation refinement of iphone pro brings subtle changes emphasizing gradual improvements over revolutionary redesigns iphone pro features a softer design slimmer bezels and a lighter build with a new titanium coating showcasing subtle but noticeable improvements introduction of usbc port allows universal compatibility but lacks significant innovation beyond onecable convenience a pro chip brings substantial power rivaling the m chip enhancing gaming capabilities and specialized tasks like fast photo processing and data transfer iphone pro faces potential issues with battery life and sporadic overheating possibly linked to the powerful a pro chip and ios bugs enhanced camera system captures megapixel images by combining detailed and light information offering slight improvements over previous models iphone pros video capabilities continue to dominate the smartphone market featuring k fps log shooting mode and improved stabilization albeit with occasional haloing issues iphone pro max introduces a larger telephoto lens with x zoom enhancing zoom capabilities and stabilization but it may not justify the bulk for most users camera differences among smartphones are heavily reliant on software making personal preference a significant factor iphone pro offers a raw max feature for megapixel pro raw photos providing enhanced customization for photographers the action button on the iphone pro is customizable allowing users to assign various functions but its positioning may limit its accessibility for some users the action buttons usability may vary from person to person some may find it extremely useful while others might forget about it after a few days of use temperature regulation significantly impacts sleep quality the eight sleep pod cover adjusts temperature enhancing sleep experience and providing valuable sleep data insights iphone pro offers incremental improvements such as usbc a faster chip brighter screen thinner bezels and enhanced cameras making personal priorities crucial in the decision to upgrade made with harpa ai

Comment: great review as always but i wish you would have gone deeper on a few items for me upgrading to the pm from the pm has been a significant improvement weight balance feelcomfort improvements of titanium are tangible and gorgeous i dont think that point should be undersold my pro max is lighter than my daughters i with no lapse in premium feel and build thats actual innovation when charging above charge speed seems improved whereas last year and prior this is where you would see a drop in speed the stock action button was a severe underwhelm imo but its quickly been rectified and expanded for me by learning more about the power of the shortcuts app and creating custom automations this revelation alone was nearly worth the price of admission for me its a powerful tool that i hope they place more focus on going forward speaking of power the battery management is improved but not noticeable which is a hint that its improved my phone is in my hand all day and i get hours screen on time before reaching i think battery improvements have reached their ceiling until the industry moves off of lithium ion last thing ill say is the new a pro chip is silly powerful especially given the additional gb of ram no hitches or hiccups no matter what im doing on the phone i dont even have to talk about the camera its untouchable this year the pm was a frustration disguised as an upgrade it was better than what came before so we had no choice but to tolerate it but i never enjoyed it apart from having a true black color option in the pro model range this pm restored my confidence in what wants to do going forward

Comment: the video on the evolution of the porsche and its comparison to the iphones development trajectory was intriguing however the analogy presented has some gaps while both the porsche and the iphone have undergone subtle changes over time the environments they exist in are not directly comparable the design progression of the porsche is a blend of maintaining its iconic brand image and optimizing for aerodynamics on the other hand the iphones modifications are primarily driven by tech innovations and the competitive landscape of the smartphone market the content appeared to have a slight bias towards apple highlighting the theme of continuous improvement this could be perceived as an indirect endorsement for upcoming content it would be enriching to present a more evenhanded view possibly by juxtaposing apples strategies with those of its peers in the tech industry delving into the tangible impacts of these evolutions beyond just cursory remarks would enhance the contents depth and relevance for the audience i appreciate the insights shared and eagerly await more comprehensive discussions in future videos

Comment: great review and top notch production as always intro was sick one thing thats worth mentioning is the sketchy marketing with the lens setup on the pro max because its still just physical lenses with and mm i watched an indepth breakdown of the cameras by tony northrup and there is actually a significant loss in image quality when zooming in until you reach exactly mm anything between mm and mm is just a digital zoomcrop breaking it down further a picture taken at mm with the pro max is actually a x crop from the mm lens this leaves you with a photo that is megapixels instead of which the software has to upscale and process you need to zoom all the way to mm before the actual telephoto lens will take over and capture the image for a lot of users the regular pro or previous model might be more useful because the gap between the normal and telephoto mm lens is smaller which means less digital zoomcropping unless you need exactly mm focal length it doesnt look like a worthwhile upgrade to me assuming northrups numbers are correct obviously apple is not the only company to do this its just something to be aware of if youre considering upgrading from last years models or not sure if you should get the pro max over the regular pro
Cleaned_Comment: great review and top notch production as always intro was sick one thing thats worth mentioning is the sketchy marketing with the lens setup on the pro max because its still just physical lenses with and mm i watched an indepth breakdown of the cameras by tony northrup and there is actually a significant loss in image quality when zooming in until you reach exactly mm anything between mm and mm is just a digital zoomcrop breaking it down further a picture taken at mm with the pro max is actually a x crop from the mm lens this leaves you with a photo that is megapixels instead of which the software has to upscale and process you need to zoom all the way to mm before the actual telephoto lens will take over and capture the image for a lot of users the regular pro or previous model might be more useful because the gap between the normal and telephoto mm lens is smaller which means less digital zoomcropping unless you need exactly mm focal length it doesnt look like a worthwhile upgrade to me assuming northrups numbers are correct obviously apple is not the only company to do this its just something to be aware of if youre considering upgrading from last years models or not sure if you should get the pro max over the regular pro

Comment: i thought the physical mute switch was much better because allows the user to see if the phone is in mute or not without even tapping the screen but through these many reviews after the pro came out i found out most people didnt use it at all and usually leave their phone in mute you guys really dont need to hear your phone ringing when youre outside in a noisy environment eg a city you really dont need to hear your phone ringing if you leave it in another room at home nowadays we say phones are a sort of extension of our arm but reading those comments makes me think this thing is real and makes me unconfortable i heard so many people saying oh finally no more mute switch since i put it on mute from the very first moment it comes out of the box and leave it in mute forever if you guys always leave your phone on mute it means you always have it with you constantly touching you so that you feel it vibrating in a pocket in hands on the desk in a silent room isnt that a bit too much seems like your lives depend on this metalandglass device cant you leave it in another room with the ringtone activated while you do something else during your daily life anyway this is just my opinion obv id like apple to put this action button on the right side because it would be easier to reach and having a configurable button is always a nice idea im not saying its useless but id love apple to reintroduce the mute switch even though i know its something that will never happen since it looks like im the only one in the world who actually liked and used it

Comment: i would always choose the pro model over the pro max until this year where they actually made it much different given the insignificant difference in price i would expect it only to have a difference in size or may be the price should be made lesser i never liked bigger phones because of my tiny hands and having to feel a controlled hand on it it is well under my consideration to have a smaller battery size in comparison as is the size as well as the display but the battery in terms of performance should in fact be equal if not even more as it uses much less of it given the size and accordingly the the performance should be much smoother too as im having less of frame drops or heating issues as the same powerful chip has been used for a much smaller and comparatively less complex a device but as soon as it released it blows the whole internet with for all the wrong reasons now you pay almost the same money and get so lesser in comparison i wouldnt go as far as calling it a bad phone anyway but compared to the other models it really seems very flawed and overpriced especially compared to the max variant now the choice leans towards the max variant as youll get used to the size in a few days anyway they didnt want to compromise the aesthetics of the body as a telephoto lenses would require to have a bulgier sensor size this is the first year i would suggest anyone a pro max over the pro i still prefer the size though but otherwise really disappointed

Comment: hey whats up everyone marques here and today i want to talk to you about my recent experience at golden corral now you know me im all about tech and gadgets but every now and then i like to indulge in some good oldfashioned comfort food and let me tell you my visit to golden corral did not disappoint first of all the variety of food at golden corral is absolutely mindblowing its like a tech geeks dream come true but with food from the moment you walk in youre greeted with an array of options that cater to just about every taste bud imaginable whether youre into classic american dishes international flavors or even some healthier options theyve got you covered now lets talk about the quality i have to say i was pleasantly surprised you might expect a buffetstyle restaurant to sacrifice quality for quantity but thats not the case here the food was consistently tasty and everything was kept fresh and hot the grill station in particular impressed me with its madetoorder steaks and seafood and their famous yeast rolls oh man those things are like the flagship smartphones of the bread worldconsistently reliable and always satisfying the dessert section at golden corral is a tech enthusiasts dream come true its like having an endless supply of your favorite gadgets and gizmos the chocolate fountain is like a highend camera capturing the sweetest moments and the softserve ice cream machine is like a welldesigned appeasy to use and highly addictive but what really sets golden corral apart is the friendly and attentive staff they make you feel right at home and their dedication to keeping the buffet clean and wellstocked is commendable in conclusion if youre looking for a techsavvy approach to buffet dining golden corral is the place to be its like having a buffet of gadgets and gizmos for your taste buds and i cant recommend it enough so if you find yourself craving some good oldfashioned comfort food dont hesitate to check out golden corral its a tech enthusiasts paradise of flavors and i give it a solid five stars thanks for watching and until next time stay hungry my friends

Comment: so i got the new iphone promax for a few reasons but i mainly use with foreflight when flying im not flying anything super fancy just a cessna without an air conditioner but here in texas this summer last years iphone ipads and even ipad pros have all had overheating issues in flight with a caseless iphone the screen dims to a near unusable level before the app shuts down and i rely heavily on this to avoid traffic ive been testing the pro max and happy that it has endured a hour long flight at max brightness without skipping a beat on a fairly hot day the phone was hot but the screen stayed bright and i didnt get any overheating warnings plus the battery didnt seem to take a super noticeable hit

Comment: in short its time for companies to prioritize sustainability and customer loyalty over shortterm profits by making software features more universally accessible than tying them to hardware where possible what bothers me is the practice of tying software features to hardware many of the new exclusive features could easily be compatible with last years phone model or even the one before that i understand making these features exclusive to new phones for a limited time but eventually they should be made available to older models google sets a good example by trickling down features to its older pixel phones this approach may lead to fewer immediate sales of new models but it builds longterm customer loyalty it also offers early adopters the incentive of immediate access to the latest features or hardware improvements like enhanced camera capabilities additionally its a more sustainable practice reducing the need for frequent hardware upgrades while rapid hardware changes were justifiable a decade ago now its more about maximizing profits
